wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General Sir Samuel Herbert Wilson  (31 October 1873 – 5 August 1950) was a British colonial administrator who served as Governor of Trinidad and Tobago between 1921 and 1924.  He did much to popularise football, offering a Wilson Cup for football.Wilson was born in Dublin in 1873, the son of Dr. James Wilson. After attending the Royal Military Academy, Woolwich, he entered the Royal Engineers in 1893. He married Marie Ada Garbarino Gervers, daughter of Francis Theodore Gervers. His sister-in-law Theodora Chevalier Gervers  married Sir Albert Hastings Markham.
